member.name: T:DevZest.Windows.Docking.Primitives.DockManager
member.summary: Provides a set of static methods and attached properties to manage docking behaviors.

remarks.para: By default, the attached property of is set to . If you change this value, you must provide all the implementation.
class handles how floating windows are displayed. When running under partial trust, will be used; otherwise will be used. You can get the value from attached property of .
class handles drag and drop through the following attached properties:

list.item: Set and attached property for elements to indicate the drop target.

The attached property for and indicates whether docking guide should be displayed. The , , , and attached properties for indicate whether the respective docking guide should be displayed. The attached property for indicates whether the SHIFT key is pressed down during drag and drop.
The attached property for , or indicates where the drop preview should be displayed. The , , , attached properties for indicates the floating preview size and location.
In control template, set attached property for to display the docking guide and preview overlay. Customize default floating window preview size by changing the value of attached property for .

member.name: T:DevZest.Windows.Docking.DockItem
member.summary: Represents a dockable item hosted by a .

remarks.para: Content Model: derives from class, set the property to organize the UI of the dockable item.
Use , , , , , , and properties to customize the DockItem.

Call Show method to show the DockItem; call Activate method to activate the DockItem; call Close method to close the DockItem (disconnect the DockItem from DockControl); call PerformClose method to close or hide the DockItem, depending on the value of property. You may intercept the Closing event to cancel the DockItem closing.
The has the following state reflected by its and other properties:

item.description: The DockItem is not connected to any DockControl. The values of its , and properties are all .
The DockItem is hidden with its property set to .

The DockItem is visible with its property set to , plus the following properties to reflect the state:
The property indicates whether this DockItem is selected (DockControl.SelectedAutoHideItem or its 's returns this ).
The property indicates whether this DockItem is active (DockControl.ActiveItem returns this ).
The property indicates whether this DockItem is active document (DockControl.ActiveDocument returns this ).
The property indicates whether this DockItem is in auto-hide mode.
Call ToggleAutoHide method to toggle the auto hide state of the DockItem's ; call ToggleFloating method to toggle the floating state of the DockItem.

remarks.para: You may intercept the or event, which occurs before or after the state of DockItem changed.

Derived class may override the Save method to return a object instance represents this DockItem for saving/loading the window layout, or override the property to return a DockItem reference for undo/redo.

member.name: P:DevZest.Windows.Docking.DockItem.UndoRedoReference
member.summary: Gets a value provides a reference for undo/redo.
member.value: The to provide a reference for undo/redo. The default implementation returns current when is , otherwise returns . Derived class can override to provide its own implementation.

remarks.para: When undo/redo an operation that previously removes a from DockControl.DockItems, such as closing a , a instance of needs to be retrieved and added back to DockControl.DockItems. Instead of holding this instance in the undo stack and preventing it from garbage collected, a instance of instance is kept in the undo stack. This provides flexibility to optimize memory usage.
implements , which returns itself. Returns itself keeps this in undo stack and prevents it from garbage collected. Returns a breaks the undo/redo chain and clears the undo/redo stack.

member.name: T:DevZest.Windows.MapConverter
member.summary: An implementation of that converts from one set of values to another based on the contents of the collection.

remarks.para: The MapConverter converts from one set of values to another. The source and destination values are stored in instances of inside the collection.
If this converter is asked to convert a value for which it has no knowledge, it will use the to determine how to deal with the situation.

member.example:
The following example shows a MapConverter being used to control the visibility of a Label based on a CheckBox:
<CheckBox x:Name="_checkBox"/> <Label Content="Here is the label."> <Label.Visibility> <Binding Path="IsChecked" ElementName="_checkBox" FallbackValue="Collapsed"> <Binding.Converter> <MapConverter> <Mapping To="{x:Static Visibility.Visible}"> <Mapping.From> <sys:Boolean>True</sys:Boolean> </Mapping.From> </Mapping> </MapConverter> </Binding.Converter> </Binding> </Label.Visibility> </Label>

The following example shows how a MapConverter can be used to convert between values of the enumeration and human-readable strings. Notice how not all possible values are present in the mappings. The fallback behavior is set to ReturnOriginalValue to ensure that any conversion failures result in the original value being returned:
<Label> <Label.Content> <Binding Path="UriFormat"> <Binding.Converter> <MapConverter FallbackBehavior="ReturnOriginalValue"> <Mapping From="{x:Static sys:UriFormat.SafeUnescaped}" To="Safe unescaped"/> <Mapping From="{x:Static sys:UriFormat.UriEscaped}" To="URI escaped"/> </MapConverter> </Binding.Converter> </Binding> </Label.Content> </Label>

member.name: F:DevZest.Windows.MapConverter.FallbackBehaviorProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:DevZest.Windows.MapConverter.FallbackBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the fallback behavior for this MapConverter. This is a dependency property.

remarks.para: The fallback behavior determines how this MapConverter treats failed conversions. ReturnUnsetValue (the default) specifies that any failed conversions should return , which can be used in combination with Binding.FallbackValue to default bindings to a specific value.

Alternatively, FallbackBehavior.ReturnOriginalValue can be specified so that failed conversions result in the original value being returned. This is useful where mappings are only necessary for a subset of the total possible values. Mappings can be specified where necessary and other values can be returned as is by the MapConverter by setting the fallback behavior to ReturnOriginalValue.

member.value: The fallback behavior of this MapConverter.

member.summary: Gets the collection of objects configured for this MapConverter.

remarks.para: Each defines a relationship between a source object (see ) and a destination (see ). The MapConverter uses these mappings whilst attempting to convert values.

member.value: The collection of objects configured for this MapConverter.

member.name: T:DevZest.Windows.SplitContainer
member.summary: Represents a control consisting of two resizable objects.

remarks.para: You can add two children to the two resizable areas, and you can add other controls to existing to create many resizable display areas.

Use the control to divide the display area of a container (such as a ) and allow the user to resize UI elements that are added to the panels. When the user passes the mouse pointer over the splitter, the cursor changes to indicate that the controls inside the SplitContainer control can be resized.
Use and to specify two resizable children. Use to specify horizontal orientation. The default orientation of the is vertical.

Use and to specify where the splitter starts. Double click the splitter auto sizes or , depending on the value of . Use to indicate whether updated as the user drags the splitter. Use and to specify how far the splitter moves at a time. The default for is 1 and is 10.
Use and to specify how close the splitter bar can be moved to the outside edge of a . The default value is 20.
Use , , , , , and properties to customize the splitter and drag preview.

member.example: The following example shows a sample use of .

member.name: T:DevZest.Windows.SplitterDistance
member.summary: Represents the size of resizable areas.
member.remarks:
When property is , it represents auto sizing: the actual size will be determined by the content's desired size. When property is , the size will be calculated based on weighted proportion of available space.
The value can have following values in XAML ("?" represents a double value): "Auto": Auto size in pixel. The subsequent resizing by mouse drog or arrow key will result in a type value.
"Auto*": Auto size in weighted proportion. The subsequent resizing by mouse drog or arrow key will result in a type value.
"*": Equals "1*".
"?*": Weighted proportion: resultSize = totalAvailableSize * ? / (? + 1).
"?": Equals "?px".
"?px": ? device-independent units (1/96th inch per unit).
"?in": ? inch; 1in==96px.
"?cm": ? centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54)px.
"?pt": ? points; 1pt==(96/72)px.
